nodes.bodyText: writing query manually is more prone to error, please add tests to cover every single method that you added here. It can be unit tests at the repository level to simply verify that they do not fail and return the expected results.

+              + "st.name AS studyName, st.id AS studyId, st.custom_id AS customStudyId, st.type AS studyType,ps.status AS participantStudyStatus, ps.withdrawal_time AS withdrawalTime,ps.enrolled_time AS enrolledTime "
+              + "FROM user_details ud "

+  public List<AppParticipantsInfo> findUserDetailsByAppId(String appId);

+  @Query(
+      value =
+          "SELECT ud.id AS userDetailsId, psi.site_id as siteId, psi.study_info_id AS studyId, loc.custom_id AS locationCustomId, loc.name AS locationName "
+              + "FROM participant_study_info psi, locations loc, sites s, user_details ud "
+              + "WHERE ud.id=psi.user_details_id AND psi.study_info_id=s.study_id AND psi.site_id=s.id AND loc.id=s.location_id AND "
+              + "ud.app_info_id=:appId AND psi.status NOT IN (:excludeParticipantStudyStatus) "
+              + "AND ud.id IN (:userIds)",

+  @Query(

nodes.bodyText:
site and location are two different concepts, please keep the naming consistent.
as it is, this looks like an error to me.
Renamed customSiteId to customLocationId and siteName to locationName in AppSiteDetails class.
same here. please rename, if they are indeed the same thing.
Renamed customSiteId to customLocationId and siteName to locationName in AppSiteDetails class.

why is siteStatus set to studyStatus? if they are supposed to hold the same value, they should be named the same.
We do not need to store site status, if it will always be the same as study status.
Renamed siteStatus to participantStudyStatus because it is participant study status not site status.
are these changes covered by existing tests? if not, please add test coverage.
All the changes are covered in existing test case.
